The poop was beaten gold; Purple the sails#Comma and so perfumed that The winds were love-sick with them; the oars were silver#Comma Which to the tune of flutes kept stroke and made The water which they beat to follow faster#Comma As amorous of their strokes. For her own person#Comma It beggar'd all description.

To die#Comma to sleep - No more; and by a sleep to say we end The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks That flesh is heir to#Comma 'tis a consummation Devoutly to be wish'd. To die#Comma to sleep; To sleep#Comma perchance to dream. Ay#Comma there's the rub; For in that sleep of death what dreams may come#Comma When we have shuffled off this mortal coil#Comma Must give us pause.
